intro: Obione magdalenae, commonly known as the Magdalen's obione, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Obione magdalenae is considered endangered and is of great interest to botanists and conservationists.
